answers.answer: If the doctor told you not to worry, try not to worry.  If you still feel uncomfortable with what she said, call her and talk.  Ask her all the questions you want.  That's what docs are there for.  If she still isn't helping, get a second opinion.  That's what I had to do with my pregnancy.  My original doctor was no help at all when I started spotting in my pregnancy, so I made an appointment with another doc who was much more helpful.  Unfortunately I m/ced anyway, but I was much better informed with the 2nd doc.  I mentioned this yesterday, but I'll suggest it again: get your progesterone tested.  If it is low or is dropping, you can try supplements.  This may not help-I still m/ced with progesterone suppositories-but some women have a lot of success with it.  Good luck.  My thoughts are with you.

I had placenta previa with 2 of 5 of my pregnanies. They told me no sex or anything strenuous until it corrected itself. The reason is because it is easy to spot and bleed when the placenta is over the cervix. With both pregnancies the previa had corrected itself and moved off the cervix by my 18-20 week sonogram. It is pretty common early on to have low lying placenta but usually it corrects itself and doesn't cause much problem.
Thank they told me the same thing. I have stopped spotting for now so I feel much better! I go back to the doctor on the 18th so hopefully everything looks good with the baby and me.

Hi!  I am 12 weeks pregnant with my third child.  I had two normal pregnancies, so it came as quite a shock when I was told that I have placenta previa.  What I have been reading about it does not comfort me one bit.  My doctor told me no lifting, no housework, no long walking and no sex.  She also said a c-section would be needed for delivery.  What is making me nervous is all I am reading about the heavy bleeding and preterm labor..Is there anyone that could give me some comforting information?

question: Im 10 weeks pregnant and have had an almost perfect pregnancy. I have had 2 c-section in the past 3 years and 1 miscarriage a few months ago. I started to spot and cramp yesterday and it has continued today. I went to my Doctor and she did an ultrasound and said the baby looked great but that my placenta was over my cervix. She didn't sound to concerned about it though and never really told me why im spotting or cramping. Im very worried. My mom had 3 placenta previas. Could this spotting and cramping be because of the low lying placenta or is it something else? I have also had my two children early (33 and 35 weeks) because of severe preeclampsia and pre-term labor. I was hoping that maybe someone could give me some insight on this.Thank you- Tiffany
title: Can my  low lying placenta cause spotting this early? Is it something else?
